      • generateDefaultParam

        public void generateDefaultParam()
        This function generates default parameters for a game by setting percentages for different types of game elements.

      • generateParam

        public void generateParam(CustomParm c)
        The function generates game parameters based on the input custom parameters and adds corresponding occupants to the game board.
        Parameters:
        c - A CustomParm object that contains the percentages of different types of occupants to be generated in the game grid. These include glue, carte, hunter, sage, cheater, and tool.

      • createCarte

        public void createCarte(int x,
                        int y)
        This function creates a Carte object with a specified position and adds it to a game board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position where the Carte object will be created.
        y - The y parameter represents the vertical position of the Carte object being created.

      • noMoreEmptyPostion

        public boolean noMoreEmptyPostion()
        This function checks if there are any empty positions left on a game map.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if there are no more empty positions on the game map, and false otherwise.

      • randomEmptyPosition

        public Position randomEmptyPosition()
        The function returns a random empty position on a game map.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Position object, which represents a random empty position on the game map.

      • isWin

        public boolean isWin()
        This function checks if there is a Hunter object that has won among the mouvable objects.
        Returns:
        The method `isWin()` returns a boolean value. The method `isWin()` is checking if there is a `Hunter` object in the `mouvable` list and if that `Hunter` object has won the game. If there is a `Hunter` object that has won, then the method returns `true`. Otherwise, it returns `false`.

      • createTesor

        public void createTesor()
        This function creates a treasure object at a random empty position on a game board.

      • createCheater

        public void createCheater()
        This Java function creates a Cheater object at a random empty position on a game board.

      • createHunter

        public void createHunter(int x,
                         int y,
                         int dirX,
                         int dirY)
        The function creates a new Hunter object with a given position and direction, adds it to a list of mobile objects, and assigns it a unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position where the Hunter object will be created.
        y - The y parameter represents the vertical position of the Hunter object being created.
        dirX - dirX is the horizontal direction of the Hunter's movement. It can be either -1 (left), 0 (no horizontal movement), or 1 (right).
        dirY - dirY is the direction of movement in the y-axis for the Hunter object being created. It is an integer value that can be either positive or negative, indicating the direction of movement upwards or downwards respectively.

      • createSage

        public void createSage(int x,
                       int y,
                       int dirX,
                       int dirY)
        The function creates a Sage object with a given position and direction and adds it to a list of mobile objects.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position where the Sage object will be created.
        y - The y parameter represents the vertical position of the Sage object being created.
        dirX - dirX is the direction of movement in the x-axis for the Sage object being created. It is an integer value that can be either positive or negative, indicating the direction of movement to the right or left, respectively.
        dirY - dirY is the direction of movement in the y-axis for the Sage object being created. It is an integer value that can be either positive or negative, indicating the direction of movement upwards or downwards respectively.

      • createHunter

        public void createHunter()
        This function creates a new Hunter object and adds it to a list of mobile objects if there is an available position on the game board.

      • nextTour

        public boolean nextTour()
        The function iterates through a list of movable objects and performs their movements until a hunter wins or there are no more movable objects.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if all the movable objects have been moved and a hunter has won the game, and false otherwise.

      • oneTurn

        public boolean oneTurn()
        This function executes one turn of a game by moving an object and checking if it has won.
        Returns:
        The method `oneTurn()` returns a boolean value. If all the movable objects have been moved and there are no more moves left, it returns `true`. If a Hunter object has reached the target and won the game, it also returns `true`. Otherwise, it returns `false`.

        public int generate(int min,

        This Java function generates a random integer between a minimum and maximum value, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value that can be generated by the method.
        max - The maximum value that can be generated by the method.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value that is randomly generated between the minimum and maximum values provided as parameters.

      • generateWallAt

        public void generateWallAt(Position start,
                           Position end)
        The function generates a wall of stones between two given positions in a game.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting position of the wall to be generated. It is an object of the class Position, which contains the x and y coordinates of the starting point.
        end - The "end" parameter is a Position object that represents the end point of the wall to be generated.
